badlib

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • badlib.Path

  • public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes in specific inputs for how the robot should be moving over a period of time and creates a path from that information. You can query this class's methods to find different pieces of information about the path at a given time.
    Author:
    andrew

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double ANGLE_MAX_ACCEL 
      static double POSITION_MAX_ACCEL 
      static double ROBOT_RADIUS

    • Constructor Detail

      • Path

        public Path(double omega1,
            double omega2,
            double middleTime,
            double startSpeed,
            double wantedSpeed,
            double endSpeed,
            double omegaStartCoast,
            double omegaMiddleCoast,
            double omegaEndCoast,
            double speedStartCoast,
            double speedEndCoast,
            double deltaTheta)
        Creates a path, if possible, with these given parameters. Will use ANGLE_MAX_ACCEL and POSITION_MAX_ACCEL, or smaller for linear and angular acceleration.
        Parameters:
        omega1 - starting target angular velocity
        omega2 - ending target angular velocity
        middleTime - time to go from omega1 to omega2
        startSpeed - starting linear speed
        wantedSpeed - wanted linear speed at max
        endSpeed - wanted linear speed once finished
        omegaStartCoast - Delay time before angle begins changing when path starts
        omegaMiddleCoast - Wait time when omega is 0 (if it is 0) around the middle of the path
        omegaEndCoast - Wait time when omega is 0 at the end of the path before the path finishes
        speedStartCoast - Delay time before speed starts changing when path starts
        speedEndCoast - Wait time at end of speed path
        deltaTheta - total change in theta from point A to B

      • Path

        public Path(double omega1,
            double omega2,
            double middleTime,
            double startSpeed,
            double wantedSpeed,
            double endSpeed,
            double deltaTheta)
        Creates a path, if possible, with these given parameters. Will use ANGLE_MAX_ACCEL and POSITION_MAX_ACCEL, or smaller for linear and angular acceleration.
        Parameters:
        omega1 - starting target angular velocity
        omega2 - ending target angular velocity
        middleTime - time to go from omega1 to omega2
        startSpeed - starting linear speed
        wantedSpeed - wanted linear speed at max
        endSpeed - wanted linear speed once finished
        deltaTheta - total change in theta from point A to B

      • validParameters

        public static boolean validParameters(double omega1,
                                      double omega2,
                                      double middleTime,
                                      double startSpeed,
                                      double wantedSpeed,
                                      double endSpeed,
                                      double deltaTheta)
        Calculates whether given parameters will create a valid path.
        Parameters:
        omega1 - starting target angular velocity
        omega2 - ending target angular velocity
        middleTime - time to go from omega1 to omega2
        startSpeed - starting linear speed
        wantedSpeed - wanted linear speed at max
        endSpeed - wanted linear speed once finished
        deltaTheta - total change in theta from point A to B
        Returns:
        True if the path will be valid

        public void wheelSpeeds(double t,

        Finds the speed of the wheel in units at the given time.
        Parameters:
        t -
        dest - A Point where x is the left wheel and y is the right wheel -- (left, right)
